DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response for the kind of blood specimen shipped.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: fluid consisting of plasma, blood cells, and platelets taken or used for research purposes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/17/14 Reused by DCP; kept Released jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The act or business of transporting goods._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.

Concepts.definition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Blood that has not been separated into its various components; blood that has not been modified except for the addition of an anticoagulant.

Concepts.definition: Blood that has not been separated into its various components; blood that has not been modified except for the addition of an anticoagulant.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

Concepts.definition: The act or business of transporting goods.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
